metadata.Title: CVE-2021-21203 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use after free in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 90.0.4430.72 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
